title: NBA player becomes first to stand for anthem and not wear Black Lives Matter shirt
description: The Orlando Magic's Jonathan Isaac became the first NBA player to stand for the National Anthem as the league resumed play after a 20-week hiatus due to the coronavirus pandemic.

title: He held up a Black Lives Matter sign not far from KKK headquarters and recorded the reactions
description: A White filmmaker traveled to a town just outside the headquarters of the Ku Klux Klan to document reactions to him holding a Black Lives Matter sign.

title: Bolsonaro says he has 'mold' in his lungs
description: Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro said on Thursday he felt weak and might have "mold in the lung" having spent weeks in isolation after catching Covid-19.

title: Supreme Court allows continued construction of Trump's border wall
description: A divided Supreme Court on Friday allowed continued construction of a portion of President Donald Trump's border wall while legal challenges play out.

title: Boston Marathon bomber's death sentence overturned
description: A federal appeals court ruled on Friday to vacate the death sentence of convicted Boston Marathon bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev.

title: Florida teen arrested in Twitter hack that hit Biden and Obama
description: A teenager in Tampa was arrested and charged Friday for his alleged involvement in a massive Twitter hack earlier this month that took over the accounts of prominent users like Joe Biden, Bill Gates and Elon Musk and used them to promote a bitcoin scam.

title: US Majority leader McConnell tells GOP candidates: Distance from Trump if you need to
description: Sen. Mitch McConnell is allowing Republican Senate candidates to do whatever it takes to salvage their campaigns ahead of what Republicans increasingly fear could be a devastating election for their party.

title: Jake Tapper: How on Earth can Congress adjourn for the weekend?
description: The House and Senate have adjourned for the weekend without coming to an agreement on a new economic stimulus package despite the looming deadline for unemployment benefits that many have relied on during the coronavirus pandemic. CNN's Manu Raju discusses with Jake Tapper.

title: How the Kurds are in Syria doing nine months after the US left
description: CNN's Arwa Damon reports.

title: Trump's trashing of democracy will reverberate far beyond the US
Can you get Covid-19 through your eyes? Possibly. Should we all be wearing goggles? Probably not.
description: We know that the coronavirus can enter the body through the nose and mouth -- hence the constant recommendations from doctors to wear face coverings and practice social distancing.

title: A piecemeal approach kept the US from getting it under control, and now states need to 'pull out all the stops'
description: US states' "diversity of response" hampered the country's ability to contain the spread of the coronavirus, Dr. Anthony Fauci said at a Congressional hearing on Friday.

title: Joe Biden narrows down his VP list, and a candidate emerges
description: Joe Biden heads into the weekend weighing the biggest decision of his presidential campaign so far, and people close to the process tell CNN that the former vice president is believed to have now begun to narrow his personal shortlist of potential running mates to a handful of women.

title: David Duke has been banned from Twitter
description: Twitter permanently banned the account of former Ku Klux Klan leader David Duke on Thursday night, after multiple violations of the company's hateful conduct policy.

title: Fact checking Trump's claim that he is tough on Russia
description: Despite his claim that he is tough on Russia, President Donald Trump says he has not discussed US intelligence reports accusing Russia of offering bounties to Taliban fighters to kill US troops with President Vladimir Putin. CNN's Brianna Keilar breaks down 37 times Trump was soft on Russia.

title: Trump's trashing of democracy will have consequences far beyond America
description: When you are President of the United States, your words matter. Not just to your own voters, not just to your own citizens, but to people in every corner of the planet.

title: Beyoncé's visual album 'Black Is King' is a feast for the eyes
description: There are many quotable lines and lyrics in "Black Is King," Beyoncé's new visual album, which dropped today on Disney+. But two in particular seem especially apt to describe the stylistic feast the artist has created. The first comes three minutes in: "Let Black be synonymous with joy."

title: Ellen DeGeneres apologizes to staff after report of toxic culture at talk show
description: Ellen DeGeneres is apologizing to her staff in the wake of allegations that her talk show fosters a toxic environment.

title: What we've gotten wrong about how sperm move
description: Using complex mathematics and 3D imaging, a group of researchers at the University of Bristol have discovered human sperm doesn't move the way we have believed for centuries

title: The US economy is teetering on the brink of disaster, and the Senate adjourned for the weekend
description: The unemployment benefit that has kept millions afloat amid the worst economic crisis in decades officially expires at midnight. Weekly jobless claims continue to rise. Economic forecasters are warning of another slowdown. The coronavirus has resurged across the country.

title: Beyoncé drops new visual album
description: The 24-time Grammy Award-winning artist has released her hotly anticipated visual album "Black Is King," inspired by "The Lion King," on Disney+.

title: Why Black women are more likely to have fibroids than any other race group
description: Stephanie Odili knew something was wrong when her stomach ballooned to three times its usual size.

title: See the Nike ad everyone's talking about
description: Nike's latest ad sends a powerful message about Covid-19 and the Black Lives Matter movement. At a time when professional sports are struggling to start up amidst the pandemic, the ad has quickly become popular online.

title: Trump was put on speakerphone in restaurant during conversation with senator
description: President Donald Trump was put on speakerphone in a restaurant during a conversation with Senate Armed Services Chairman Jim Inhofe Wednesday, where the two discussed Trump's opposition to changing the names of US military bases named after Confederate officials, according to The New York Times.

title: Dr. Fauci and Jim Jordan get in heated exchange over protests
description: Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH) gets in a fiery exchange with Dr. Anthony Fauci over whether protests should be limited in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Researchers publish scathing critique of drug study repeatedly touted by Trump
Coke with coffee will hit US stores next year
description: Coca-Cola said Friday that it will debut a new Coke with coffee drink in stores in the United States in January to broaden its beverage lineup.

title: Golfer drove over 4,000 miles across the US to play in tournaments
description: Whether it be "On The Road Again" by Willie Nelson or "Don't Stop Believin'" by Journey, compiling a playlist for a road trip is a key part of the experience.

title: US national shot dead in Pakistan courtroom during blasphemy trial
description: A United States citizen on trial for blasphemy in Pakistan has been shot dead while appearing in court, in the latest act of violence connected to the controversial legislation.

title: F1 shock as first driver tests postive for Covid-19
description: Formula One driver Sergio Perez has tested positive for Covid-19 and will miss this weekend's British Grand Prix.

title: Meet Forest, the tallest giraffe in the world
description: A male giraffe living in a zoo in Australia has been crowned the tallest of them all, hitting a giddy 5.7 meters (18 feet, 8 inches).

title: New documents describe Maxwell's abuse of one of Epstein's alleged victims
description: Virginia Giuffre, an alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein, describes the psychological toll of Epstein's abuse in portions of a newly released deposition from May 3, 2016.

title: Activists cry foul as Hong Kong postpones election due to virus
description:
• ANALYSIS: Hong Kong is setting up an election without a real opposition
• LIVE Johnson: England putting 'brakes' on reopening
• Europe's economy suffers record 11.9% slump

title: EU blocks funding for six towns that declared themselves 'LGBT-Free Zones'
description: The European Union has denied funding to six Polish towns that declared themselves to be "LGBT-Free Zones."

title: Hotel guests checking in for the long haul
description: Forget checking into a hotel for a long weekend or a week. In the wake of Covid-19, travelers around the world are booking stays that last a month or even longer.

title: US Marine dead and 8 others missing after amphibious vehicle accident
description: At least one US Marine is dead and eight others are missing after a training accident involving an amphibious vehicle off the coast of Southern California.

title: Saudi-backed consortium pulls out of bid to buy Newcastle United
description: A Saudi Arabian-backed consortium has withdrawn its bid to buy English Premier League side Newcastle United.

title: Three charts that show how Republicans are losing their chance to keep the Senate
description: Leading election forecasters have been steadily downgrading their ratings for Republican Senate candidates throughout the year, increasing the chances of a Democratic takeover viewed as unlikely only a few months ago.

title: How Ethiopian art secured its spot on the world's stage
description: Over the last five years contemporary Ethiopian artists have been making a name for themselves on the global art market, but it's been a long time coming.

title: Canada cracks down on people traveling through the country to get to Alaska
description: People who choose to travel to Alaska through Canada are facing stricter rules starting Friday.

title: What the airplane cabin of the future might look like
description: The coronavirus pandemic has changed a lot of things -- the way we socialize, work, and the way we travel.

title: Researchers publish scathing critique of drug study repeatedly touted by Trump
description: Researchers on Wednesday published scathing critiques of a study President Trump repeatedly touted on Twitter.  That study, published earlier this month in the International Journal of Infectious Diseases, claimed to show that hydroxychloroquine saved lives.

title: Serial killer confesses involvement in more than 50 murders
description: An Indian serial killer who admitted his involvement in the murder of more than 50 taxi drivers whose bodies were dumped in a crocodile-infested canal has been caught by police after he fled to another state while out of prison on parole.

title: This uniquely Hong Kong snack is popping up around the world
description: When I decided to write a story about the origins of Hong Kong bubble waffles -- also known as "egg waffles" -- I thought it would be easy.

title: Teen's unusual swing wows golfing legends
description: Kendall Kemm got a lesson from golf legend Nick Faldo after showing off a one-armed swing. The 16-year-old lost the use of her left hand in 2014 after a stroke.

title: Bronx Zoo apologizes for putting African man on display in Monkey House
description: For one week in 1906, the Bronx Zoo in New York kept a man from Central Africa in an enclosure in its monkey house
